alert.note: Alert for Harris; Meriwether; Pike; Talbot; Troup; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 5:48AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Meriwether, Pike, Upson, southern Troup, northern Talbot and northern Harris Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 547 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Stovall, or 9 miles southwest of Greenville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... LaGrange, Thomaston, Zebulon, Hamilton, Talbotton, Greenville, Manchester, West Point, Pine Mountain, Woodbury, Warm Springs, Woodland, Molena, Williamson, Meansville, Gay, Sunset Village, Pine Mountain-Callaway Gardens, Lincoln Park and Shiloh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Harris; Meriwether; Pike; Talbot; Troup; Upson
